Hi,

I just joined the forum yesterday.  Thanks for having me, I find NEAT
=
quite fascinating.

Today, despite the confounding effect of nearly no know=
ledge of
computer programming, I opened up the sharpNEAT source code and tr=
y to
get a basic understanding of what's going on.  I wrote my own little
e=
xperiment as a trial, basically copying another experiment's files
with min=
or changes into my own experiment folder and modifying the
app.config file =
so it would show up on the dropdown experiment list...
so far so good.

Nex=
t up is to try to figure out how to take the neural net that is
evolved and=
 apply it to some out of sample data, and this is where I'm
bogged down.  H=
ow can I create a file that opens up a neural net that
was previously saved=
, apply some given inputs, and give me the output?
 Is there some sample co=
de already in the source code that might point
me in the right direction?

=
Similarly, is there a way to start a NEAT process without going
through the=
 GUI?  I'm sure this is possible, but I'm assuming it's a
lot more complica=
ted than my first question?

Thanks,
